intro: Oxytropis tujaksuensis, commonly known as the Tujaksu oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It has adapted to survive in harsh environments with deep taproots and reduced leaf surfaces. Oxytropis tujaksuensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
